properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the credential.

properties.name: value
properties.description: • value - (Required) Value of the credential.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Description of the credential.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Deployment name.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Deployment description.

properties.name: resource_group_href
properties.description: • resource_group_href - (Optional) Href of the Windows Azure Resource Group attached to the deployment.

properties.name: locked
properties.description: • locked - (Optional) Set to true to lock the deployment.

properties.name: server_tag_scope
properties.description: • server_tag_scope - (Optional) Routing scope for tags for servers in the deployment. Options are 'account' or 'deployment,' defaults to 'deployment.'
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the instance.

properties.name: cloud_href
properties.description: • cloud_href - (Required) The cloud_href the instance belongs to.

properties.name: image_href
properties.description: • image_href - (Required) The href of the instance image.

properties.name: instance_type_href
properties.description: • instance_type_href - (Required) The href of the instance type.

properties.name: server_template_href
properties.description: • server_template_href - (Optional) The href of the instance server template resource.

properties.name: inputs
properties.description: • inputs - (Optional) Inputs associated with an instance when incarnated from a server or server_array.

properties.name: associate_public_ip_address
properties.description: • associate_public_ip_address - (Optional) Indicates if the instance will get a Public IP address.

properties.name: datacenter_href
properties.description: • datacenter_href - (Optional) The href of the datacenter that holds the instance (e.g. /api/clouds/6/datacenters/6IHONC8ANOUHI).

properties.name: deployment_href
properties.description: • deployment_href - (Optional) The href of the deployment that contains the instance (e.g. /api/deployments/594684003).

properties.name: ip_forwarding_enabled
properties.description: • ip_forwarding_enabled - (Optional) Allows this Instance to send and receive network traffic when the source and destination IP addresses do not match the IP address of this Instance.

properties.name: private_ip_address
properties.description: • private_ip_address - (Optional) The private ip address of this instance.

properties.name: kernel_image_href
properties.description: • kernel_image_href - (Optional) The href of the instance kernel image.

properties.name: ramdisk_image_href
properties.description: • ramdisk_image_href - (Optional) The href of the instance ramdisk image.

properties.name: security_group_hrefs
properties.description: • security_group_hrefs - (Optional) The href of the instance security groups.

properties.name: placement_group_href
properties.description: • placement_group_href - (Optional) The href of the placement_group that contains the instance (e.g. /api/placement_groups/512SV3FUJA7OO).

properties.name: ssh_key_href
properties.description: • ssh_key_href - (Optional) The href of the SSH key to use.

properties.name: subnet_hrefs
properties.description: • subnet_hrefs - (Optional) The hrefs of the instance subnet.

properties.name: user_data
properties.description: • user_data - (Optional) User data that RightScale automatically passes to your instance at boot time.

properties.name: locked
properties.description: • locked - (Optional) Whether instance is locked, a locked instance cannot be terminated or deleted.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: cloud_specific_attributes - (Optional) Attributes specific to the cloud the instance belongs to that have no specific rightscale abstraction. This block supports:

properties.name: admin_username
properties.description: The user that will be granted administrative privileges. Supported by AzureRM cloud only.

properties.name: automatic_instance_store_mapping
properties.description: A flag indicating whether instance store mapping should be enabled.  Only available on clouds supporting automatic instance store mapping.

properties.name: availability_set
properties.description: Availability set for raw instance. Supported by Azure v2 cloud only.

properties.name: create_boot_volume
properties.description: If enabled, the instance will launch into volume storage. Otherwise, it will boot to local storage.  Only available on clouds supporting this option.

properties.name: create_default_port_forwarding_rules
properties.description: Automatically create default port forwarding rules (enabled by default). Supported by Azure cloud only.

properties.name: delete_boot_volume
properties.description: If enabled, the associated volume will be deleted when the instance is terminated.  Only available on clouds supporting this option.

properties.name: disk_gb
properties.description: The size of root disk. Supported by UCA cloud only.

properties.name: ebs_optimized
properties.description: Whether the instance is able to connect to IOPS-enabled volumes.  AWS clouds only.

properties.name: iam_instance_profile
properties.description: The name or ARN of the IAM Instance Profile (IIP) to associate with the instance. AWS clouds only.

properties.name: keep_alive_id
properties.description: The id of keep alive. Supported by UCA cloud only.

properties.name: local_ssd_count
properties.description: Additional local SSDs. Supported by GCE cloud only.

properties.name: local_ssd_interface
properties.description: The type of SSD(s) to be created. Supported by GCE cloud only.

properties.name: max_spot_price
properties.description: Specify the max spot price you will pay for. Required when 'pricing_type' is 'spot'. Only applies to clouds which support spot-pricing and when 'spot' is chosen as the 'pricing_type'. Should be a Float value >= 0.001, eg: 0.095, 0.123, 1.23, etc... AWS clouds only.

properties.name: memory_mb
properties.description: The size of instance memory. Supported by UCA cloud only.

properties.name: metadata"
properties.description: Extra data used for configuration, in query string format. AWS clouds only.

properties.name: num_cores
properties.description: The number of instance cores. Supported by UCA cloud only.

properties.name: placement_tenancy
properties.description: The tenancy of the server you want to launch. A server with a tenancy of dedicated runs on single-tenant hardware and can only be launched into a VPC.  AWS clouds only.

properties.name: preemptible
properties.description: Launch a preemptible instance. A preemptible instance costs much less, but lasts only 24 hours. It can be terminated sooner due to system demands. Supported by GCE cloud only.

properties.name: pricing_type
properties.description: Specify whether or not you want to utilize 'fixed' (on-demand) or 'spot' pricing. Defaults to 'fixed' and only applies to clouds which support spot instances. Can only be set on when creating a new Instance, Server, or ServerArray, or when updating a Server or ServerArray's next_instance.  AWS clouds only.

properties.name: root_volume_performance
properties.description: The number of IOPS (I/O Operations Per Second) this root volume should support. Only available on clouds supporting performance provisioning.

properties.name: root_volume_size
properties.description: The size for root disk. Only available on clouds supporting dynamic resizing of root volume size.

properties.name: root_volume_type_uid
properties.description: The type of root volume for instance. Only available on clouds supporting root volume type.

properties.name: service_account
properties.description: Email of service account for instance. Scope will default to cloud-platform. Supported by GCE cloud only.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cloud_href
properties.description: • cloud_href - (Required) Cloud you want to create the network gateway in.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) Type of network gateway. Options are "internet" or "vpc".

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Network gateway name.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Network gateway description.

properties.name: network_href
properties.description: • network_href - (Optional) Href of network you want to attach the network gateway to.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cloud_href
properties.description: • cloud_href - (Required) Cloud you want to create the network in.

properties.name: cidr_block
properties.description: • cidr_block - (Optional*) Cloud-specific. Some clouds require this field, others do not.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Network name.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Network description.

properties.name: instance_tenancy
properties.description: • instance_tenancy - (Optional) Launch policy for AWS instances in the network. Specify 'dedicated' to force all instances to be launched as 'dedicated'. Defaults to 'default.'

properties.name: route_table_href
properties.description: • route_table_href - (Optional) Sets the default route table for this network, useful if you create the route table with a different resource.

properties.name: deployment_href
properties.description: • deployment_href - (Optional) Href of the deployment that owns the network. If you wish to use a deployment object as top level ownership construct, perhaps allocating the new network to a single deployment, then provide this href.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cloud_href
properties.description: • cloud_href - (Required) Href of the cloud you want to create the route table in.

properties.name: network_href
properties.description: • network_href - (Required) Href of the network that owns the route table.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Route table name.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Route table description.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: route_table_href
properties.description: • route_table_href - (Required) Href of route table in which to create new route.

properties.name: destination_cidr_block
properties.description: • destination_cidr_block - (Required) Destination network in CIDR nodation.

properties.name: next_hop_type
properties.description: • next_hop_type - (Required) The route next hop type. Options are 'instance', 'network_interface', 'network_gateway', 'ip_string', and 'url'.

properties.name: next_hop_href
properties.description: • next_hop_href - (Contextual) The href of the Route's next hop. Required if 'next_hop_type' is 'instance', 'network_interface', or 'network_gateway'.

properties.name: next_hop_ip
properties.description: • next_hop_ip - (Contextual) The IP Address of the Route's next hop. Required if 'next_hop_type' is 'ip_string'.

properties.name: next_hop_url
properties.description: • next_hop_url - (Contextual) The URL of the Route's next hop. Required if 'next_hop_type' is 'url'.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Route description.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: source_type
properties.description: • source_type - (Required) Source type. May be a CIDR block or another Security Group. Options are 'cidr_ips' or 'group'.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) Protocol to filter on. Options are 'tcp', 'udp', 'icmp' and 'all'.

properties.name: security_group_href
properties.description: • security_group_href - (Required) Href of parent security group.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: protocol_details - (Required) Block options include:

properties.name: start_port
properties.description: (Contextual) - Start of port range (inclusive). Required if protocol is 'tcp' or 'udp'.

properties.name: end_port
properties.description: (Contextual) - End of port range (inclusive). Required if protocol is 'tcp' or 'udp'.

properties.name: icmp_code
properties.description: (Contextual) - ICMP code. Required if protocol is 'icmp'.

properties.name: icmp_type
properties.description: (Contextual) - ICMP type. Required if protocol is 'icmp'.

properties.name: cidr_ips
properties.description: • cidr_ips - (Contextual) An IP address range in CIDR notation. Required if source_type is 'cidr'. Conflicts with 'group_name' and 'group_owner'.

properties.name: group_name
properties.description: • group_name - (Contextual) Name of source Security Group. Required if source_type is 'group'. Conflicts with 'cidr_ips'.

properties.name: group_owner
properties.description: • group_owner - (Contexual) Owner of source Security Group. Required if source_type is 'group'. Conflicts with 'cidr_ips'.

properties.name: direction
properties.description: • direction - (Optional) Direction of traffic to apply rule against. Options are 'ingress' or 'egress'.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: • priority - (Optional) Lower takes precedence. Supported by security group rules created in Microsoft Azure only.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cloud_href
properties.description: • cloud_href - (Required) Href of the cloud you want to create the security group in.

properties.name: network_href
properties.description: • network_href - (Required) Href of the network to create the security group in.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Security group name.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Security group description.

properties.name: deployment_href
properties.description: • deployment_href - (Optional) Href of the deployment that owns the security group. If you wish to use a deployment object as top level ownership construct, perhaps allocating the new security group to a single deployment, then provide this href.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the server_array

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Description of the server_array

properties.name: state
properties.description: • state - (Required) he status of the server array. If enabled, the server array is enabled for scaling actions. One of "enabled" or "disabled"

properties.name: deployment_href
properties.description: • deployment_href - (Required) Href of deployment in which to create server_array

properties.name: array_type
properties.description: • array_type - (Required) The type of server_array. One of "alert" or "queue"

properties.name: optimized
properties.description: • optimized - (Optional) A flag indicating whether Instances of this ServerArray should be optimized for high-performance volumes (e.g. Volumes supporting a specified number of IOPS). Not supported in all Clouds.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: datacenter_policy - (Required) This is an array of datacenter policies. Each one must contain:

properties.name: datacenter_href
properties.description: (Required) The href of the server_array's datacenter / zone.

properties.name: max
properties.description: (Required) Maximum numbers of servers that can be allocated in this datacenter (0 for unlimited).

properties.name: weight
properties.description: (Required) Instance allocation (should total 100% accross datacenter_policies).

properties.name: list description
properties.description: elasticity_params - (Required)

properties.name: bounds
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: min_count
properties.description: (Required) The minimum number of servers that must be operational at all times in the server array.

properties.name: max_count
properties.description: (Required) The maximum number of servers that can be operational at the same time in the server array.

properties.name: pacing
properties.description:
(Required)
  • resize_down_by

properties.name: resize_down_by
properties.description: (Required) The number of servers to scale down by.

properties.name: resize_up_by
properties.description: (Required) The number of servers to scale up by.

properties.name: resize_calm_time
properties.description: (Optional) The time (in minutes) on how long you want to wait before you repeat another action.

properties.name: alert_specific_params
properties.description: (Required if alert array_type specified)

properties.name: decision_threshold
properties.description: (Required) The percentage of servers that must agree in order to trigger an alert before an action is taken.

properties.name: voters_tag_predicate
properties.description: (Optional) The Voters Tag that RightScale will use in order to determine when to scale up/down.

properties.name: queue_specific_params
properties.description: (Required if queue alert_type specified)

properties.name: collect_audit_entries
properties.description: (Optional) The audit SQS queue that will store audit entries.

properties.name: item_age
properties.description:
(Required)
  • algorithm

properties.name: algorithm
properties.description: (Optional) The algorithm that defines how an item's age will be determined, either by the average age or max (oldest) age.

properties.name: max_age
properties.description: (Optional) The threshold (in seconds) before a resize action occurs on the server array.

properties.name: regexp
properties.description: (Optional) The regexp that helps the system determine an item's \"age\" in the queue. Example: created_at: (\d\d\d\d-\d\d-\d\d \d\d:\d\d:\d\d UTC)

properties.name: queue_size
properties.description: (Required) Defines the ratio of worker instances per items in the queue. Example: If there are 50 items in the queue and \"Items per instance\" is set to 10, the server array will resize to 5 worker instances (50/10). Default = 1

properties.name: resize_down_by
properties.description: (Required) The number of servers to scale down by.

properties.name: resize_up_by
properties.description: (Required) The number of servers to scale up by.

properties.name: resize_calm_time
properties.description: (Optional) The time (in minutes) on how long you want to wait before you repeat another action.

properties.name: algorithm
properties.description: (Optional) The algorithm that defines how an item's age will be determined, either by the average age or max (oldest) age.

properties.name: max_age
properties.description: (Optional) The threshold (in seconds) before a resize action occurs on the server array.

properties.name: regexp
properties.description: (Optional) The regexp that helps the system determine an item's \"age\" in the queue. Example: created_at: (\d\d\d\d-\d\d-\d\d \d\d:\d\d:\d\d UTC)

properties.name: queue_size
properties.description: (Required) Defines the ratio of worker instances per items in the queue. Example: If there are 50 items in the queue and \"Items per instance\" is set to 10, the server array will resize to 5 worker instances (50/10). Default = 1

properties.name: list description
properties.description: schedule - (Optional)

properties.name: day
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the day when an alert-based array resizes. One of "Sunday", "Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", "Friday", "Saturday".

properties.name: max_count
properties.description: (Required) The maximum number of servers that must be operational at all times in the server array. NOTE: Any changes that are made to the min/max count in the server array schedule will overwrite the array's default min/max count settings.

properties.name: min_count
properties.description: (Required) The minimum number of servers that must be operational at all times in the server array. NOTE: Any changes that are made to the min/max count in the server array schedule will overwrite the array's default min/max count settings.

properties.name: time
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the time when an alert-based array resizes.

properties.name: instance
properties.description: • instance - (Required) See rightscale_instance
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the server

properties.name: deployment_href
properties.description: • deployment_href - (Required) The href of the deployment the server will be placed in.

properties.name: instance
properties.description: • instance - (Required) See rightscale_instance.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the server.

properties.name: optimized
properties.description: • optimized - (Optional) A flag indicating whether instances of this server should be optimized for high-performance volumes.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) Any tags you want attached to the server and any instances created from this server object.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cloud_href
properties.description: • cloud_href - (Required) The href of the cloud with the ssh key you want.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) SSH Key name.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: cloud_href
properties.description: • cloud_href - (Required) Href of cloud you want to create the subnet in.

properties.name: network_href
properties.description: • network_href - (Required) Href of network to create subnet in.

properties.name: cidr_block
properties.description: • cidr_block - (Required) Subnet allocation range in CIDR notation.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Subnet name.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Subnet description.

properties.name: datacenter_href
properties.description: • datacenter_href - (Optional) Href of cloud datacenter to assign subnet to.

properties.name: route_table_href
properties.description: • route_table_href - (Optional) Sets the default route table for this subnet, useful if you create the route table with a different resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: source
properties.description: • source - (Required) Source code to be executed, written in RCL (RightScale CloudWorkFlow Language). Several functions can be defined but the entry function should be called main. Example: hcl source = <<EOF define adder($n1, $n2) return $res do $res = $n1 + $n2 end define main($a, $b) return $result do call adder($a, $b) retrieve $tmp $result = "The total is " + $tmp end EOF

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: • parameters - Parameters for the RCL function. It consists of an array of values corresponding to the values being passed to the function defined in the "source" field in order of declaration. The values are defined as string maps with the "kind" and "value" keys. "kind" contains the type of the value being passed, could be one of "array", "boolean", "collection", "datetime", "declaration", "null", "number", "object", "string". The "value" key contains the value For example: hcl parameters = [ { "kind" = "string" "value" = "db-slave-" }, { "kind" = "number" "value" = "42" } ] Note that the "value" key should always be a string (regardless of the type specified in "kind"). These are several examples on how to pass arrays: hcl parameters = [ { "kind" = "array" "value" = "[ 22.3, 9.7, 10 ]" }, { "kind" = "array" "value" = "[ \"It\", \" works!\" ]" }, { "kind" = "array" "value" = "${jsonencode(var.zones)}" }, ]
